p: In Nb-silicide based alloys, the microstructure at the alloy (substrate)/scale interface contains contaminated Nb ss (i.e., bcc Nb solid solution with increased solid solubility of oxygen compared with the Nb ss in the bulk of the alloy), and tetragonal Nb 5Si 3 silicides with prototype W 5Si 3 (tI32, D8 m) and/or Cr 5B 3 (tI32, D8 l) and hexagonal Nb 5Si 3 (hP16, D8 8, prototype Mn 5Si 3) [ 5]. A15 compounds and other intermetallic phases can also be present [ 2, 5]. In the Nb 5Si 3 silicide, the Si can be substituted by Al and Sn [ 6, 7, 10]. A15 compounds can be rich in Al, Ge, Si and/or Sn [ 10]. The A15–Nb 3Si is a metastable phase in the Nb–Si binary system. The Nb 5Si 3 silicide(s) can be contaminated by oxygen, depending on their composition. The A15 compounds also can be contaminated by oxygen.
